result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard E. Kaiser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery of Methamphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CM107

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No possession or use of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with: R.P., J.K., A.W., T.O., M.R. or their residences.

Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already given.
Must give a complete and truthful statement about any illegal activity within his knowledge.  To the extent the statement implicates him in any further illegal drug activity, the State would agree not to issue charges.  Must testify truthfully in any proceedings against any implicated individuals.  Truthfulness in his statement and/or testimony would be subject to an Eau Claire Police Department polygraph if the State deems necessary.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted.
90 days stayed pending compliance in Mental Health Court and probation.
Report on Monday (9/22/2014)
